news.title: Puravankara acquires 53-acre land parcel in Bengaluru
news.para: Puravankara has secured a significant 53.5-acre land parcel in Bengaluru. This acquisition is expected to generate a gross development value exceeding ₹4,800 crore. The company has been actively expanding its developable area, with this latest addition boosting its potential GDV significantly.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Auda clears transit oriented zone benefits for 4,604 hectares along 10 roads
news.para: Ahmedabad Urban Development Authority has approved extending Transit Oriented Zone benefits to over 4,600 hectares of land. This includes higher floor space index and parking concessions along ten major city roads. These benefits will apply even where Bus Rapid Transit System corridors are not yet built. The decision aims to promote dense development along transport routes.

news.title: Unity Small Finance Bank wins three-way auction for Aviom India Housing Finance
news.para: Six companies had shown interest in acquiring Aviom India Housing Finance under the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT)-monitored process but eventually three of them participated at the challenge auction process that concluded last week.

news.title: Notice served to 4,500 homes in Gurugram's DLF 1-5 for illegal construction
news.para: Haryana government has identified 4,565 properties in DLF phases 1-5 for illegal constructions and commercial misuse of residential properties. Following a high court directive, a public notice has been issued, allowing owners to submit objections until January 16, 2026. The process aims for transparency and due process before further action.

news.title: A year on, no GR on abolition of NA tax; housing societies in Maharashtra seek clarity
news.para: Maharashtra housing societies face continued uncertainty over the abolition of non-agricultural (NA) tax in urban areas, despite a state cabinet decision over a year ago. The Maharashtra State Housing Federation has urged the government to issue a formal Government Resolution (GR) to end confusion and ensure uniform implementation, as many societies remain unsure whether to continue paying the levy.

news.title: Hyderabad civic body to roll out digital registry for properties
news.para: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation is launching a centralized, GIS-driven monitoring system with a QR-enabled mobile app to digitize urban governance. This initiative will create verified digital profiles for all city properties, enabling real-time monitoring, transparent data validation, and improved tax administration through a location-intelligent, map-centric digital verification ecosystem.

news.title: Haryana pushes for Rajiv Chowk as start point of Gurugram-Faridabad-Noida RRTS corridor
news.para: Haryana government wants Rajiv Chowk to be the start of the Gurgaon-Faridabad-Noida RRTS line. This aims to boost daily ridership and integration. However, NCRTC has concerns about higher construction costs and engineering issues. The project connects IGI Airport to Noida Airport, passing through Gurgaon and Faridabad. Officials believe Rajiv Chowk offers better connectivity and commuter access.

news.title: FIR registered against Ocean Seven Buildtech's directors after buyers allege fund diversion
news.para: An FIR has been registered against directors of Ocean Seven Buildtech for cheating and criminal breach of trust concerning a stalled affordable housing project. Buyers allege intimidation, illegal cancellation of allotted flats, and fraudulent resale of properties. Construction remains incomplete, with no clear delivery timeline.

news.title: CRDA approves over ₹1,300 crore to develop layouts in Amaravati
news.para: Amaravati's Capital Region Development Authority has approved significant funding for development projects. Over Rs 1,300 crore will be allocated for layout infrastructure. A Rs 444-crore flood pumping system is also planned.

news.title: Ambuja Cements' board approves amalgamation of ACC and Orient Cement
news.para: Ambuja Cements, part of Adani Group, has received board approval for merging ACC and Orient Cement. This strategic move aims to simplify operations and boost profitability. The company expects to enhance its cement production capacity significantly.

news.title: LIC Housing Finance reduces lending rates to 7.15% on new home loans
news.para: LIC Housing Finance has announced a reduced home loan interest rate of 7.15 percent, effective from December 22, 2025. This progressive shift aims to inspire confidence in the housing market, making homeownership a more attainable goal for many.

news.title: China Vanke's bondholders approve plan to extend grace period, reject repayment extension
news.para: China Vanke successfully postponed a potential default by obtaining a grace period for its 2 billion yuan bond repayment. Bondholders gave their nod for the extension, granting Vanke additional time to work through negotiations. Yet, a proposal to stretch the repayment timeline by one year was turned down.

news.title: UK Paints to acquire additional 14.48% stake in Berger Paints via internal restructuring
news.para: UK Paints India Private Limited is on the verge of a transformative acquisition, seeking to secure a noteworthy interest in Berger Paints India Limited. This development is part of a comprehensive internal restructuring focused on simplifying the corporate framework and cutting down on compliance costs.

news.title: Gurugram launches its first cooling action plan
news.para: Gurugram has launched its first Cooling Action Plan to combat rising heat and air-conditioning demand. The strategy emphasizes passive building design, greener materials, and efficient cooling systems, aiming to slash cooling energy use by up to two-thirds. This initiative aligns with the city's Net Zero Emissions Roadmap, ensuring climate targets are met despite increased cooling needs.

news.title: MIDC likely to allocate ₹6,000 crore for Purandar airport land acquisition
news.para: Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation plans to allocate Rs 6,000 crore for acquiring land for the Purandar airport. The Pune district administration has submitted a proposal for clearance. Farmers are demanding higher compensation and better rehabilitation benefits than what has been offered.

news.title: Consumer panel orders Green Space Infraheights to pay 12% interest for delay in flat handover
news.para: A consumer commission has ordered Green Space Infraheights Private Limited to refund Rs 12.42 lakh with 12% annual interest to buyers who did not receive possession of their apartment. The builder also faces a Rs 20,000 cost penalty for deficiency in service and unfair trade practices. The company failed to appear in court, leading to an ex-parte decision.

news.title: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate enters plotted development
news.para: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate has entered plotted development. They launched Treetopia, a 105-acre project in Pune. The project has a revenue potential of ₹600 crore. It will offer 483 residential plots.

news.title: Lucknow development body waives backdate maintenance fee on vacant flats in old schemes
news.para: Homebuyers in Lucknow have received a significant reprieve as the Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) has waived three years of backdated maintenance charges for new purchasers of vacant flats in older housing schemes. This decision, approved by the LDA Board, aims to boost sales by removing a substantial financial burden, making the purchase of unsold inventory more attractive for prospective buyers.
